message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyzed the survey data from the United Nations Development Program (UNDP) on social protection coverage and found that there is a significant gap in coverage between urban and rural areas.", "dataset": ["United Nations Development Program (UNDP)"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "Using the World Bank's Enterprise Survey data, we found that a high percentage of small and medium-sized enterprises in developing countries still lack access to finance.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We combined data from the International Energy Agency (IEA) and Global Energy Statistical Yearbook to assess the contribution of renewable energy towards reducing greenhouse gas emissions.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)", "Global Energy Statistical Yearbook"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and the World Health Organization (WHO) to estimate the prevalence of undernourishment and overweight in children under five years old.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)", "World Health Organization (WHO)"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data from the Social Security Administration's Master Beneficiary Record and found that disability beneficiaries who live in rural areas have lower average income than those living in urban areas.", "dataset": ["Social Security Administration's Master Beneficiary Record"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys, we find that work-family balance policies can help firms improve employee retention and productivity.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We used data from the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook database, and found that oil-exporting countries have higher levels of external debt than non-oil exporting countries.", "dataset": ["International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook database"], "topic": ["Debt", "Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "The study draws on data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and finds that access to finance is a key barrier for firm growth in many developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Global Burden of Disease Study, we explore the impact of air pollution on health outcomes and find evidence of significant negative effects on cognitive performance.", "dataset": ["Global Burden of Disease Study"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Brazil and Mexico, as well as complementary data on energy generation from wind and solar power.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records", "complementary data on energy generation from wind and solar power"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) and the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) to analyze the impact of intellectual property rights on trade flows among developing countries.", "dataset": ["United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)", "World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO)"], "topic": ["Trade"]}]
